normalised: Okay folks, let us talk builder reviews! So important when you are diving into the real estate market, especially here in India. We all know how tricky things can get!

unnormalised: Okay folks, let's talk builder reviews! So important when you're diving into the real estate market, especially here in India. We all know how tricky things can get!
normalised: How reliable are these online builder reviews, really? Has anyone had firsthand experience with a developer where the reviews were wildly different from reality? I am thinking of investing in a flat in a new project by "Sai Constructions" in Thane, but the reviews are a mixed bag – some say construction quality is top-notch, others complain about delays and hidden charges.

unnormalised: How reliable are these online builder reviews, really? Has anyone had firsthand experience with a developer where the reviews were wildly different from reality? I'm thinking of investing in a flat in a new project by "Sai Constructions" in Thane, but the reviews are a mixed bag – some say construction quality is top-notch, others complain about delays and hidden charges.
normalised: My biggest concern is project completion. I saw a project by "Sharma and Sons" near my office (Whitefield, Bangalore) promised possession by twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty three. Now, it is almost twentieth october two thousand and twenty four and still not done! Talk about stressful!

unnormalised: My biggest concern is project completion. I saw a project by "Sharma & Sons" near my office (Whitefield, Bangalore) promised possession by 26/01/2023. Now, it's almost 20/10/2024 and still not done! Talk about stressful!
normalised: Anyone know what to look out for specifically? Beyond just star ratings. Things like the transparency of the builder during the booking process, their response time to queries (do they actually pick up the phone after zero nine hundred hours?), and their adherence to RERA regulations. Even things like the maintenance charges after possession!

unnormalised: Anyone know what to look out for specifically? Beyond just star ratings. Things like the transparency of the builder during the booking process, their response time to queries (do they actually pick up the phone after 09:00 hrs?), and their adherence to RERA regulations. Even things like the maintenance charges after possession!
normalised: Also, any thoughts on how much weight to give to reviews that are several years old? For example, reviews from two thousand and eighteen might not be relevant today. Rupee five thousand for a detailed structural analysis report sounds good to avoid future issues? It covers the building for up to ten kilometer radius from a geological fault line. Let me know your thoughts! Dhanyavad!

unnormalised: Also, any thoughts on how much weight to give to reviews that are several years old? For example, reviews from 2018 might not be relevant today. Rs. 5000 for a detailed structural analysis report sounds good to avoid future issues? It covers the building for upto 10 km radius from a geological fault line. Let me know your thoughts! Dhanyavad!
